result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis Efren Torres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $150 fine plus costs. Cash bond applied. 60 days to pay fine/costs to avoid serving jail time.

Stayed. If defendant pays fine and costs in full on or before 11/10/15, stay will be permanent. If defendant fails to pay fine and costs in full on or before 11/10/15, stay will be lifted and defendant will need to report to jail. Good time and huber privileges granted. 60 days from sentencing date to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis Efren Torres

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Luis Efren Torres in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 2. Defendant stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 2. Court dismisses Ct. 1 but reads in for sentencing. Defendant must submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge. Bond is no longer in effect.
No violent contact with E.T.    Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Luis Efren Torres in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted 7/21/15 by jail staff.  (fingerprint card destroyed 9/16/15)
